intro: Conyza ambigua, commonly known as common blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Americas. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, blue to purple flower heads that are surrounded by pale yellow ray florets, which are characteristic of the Asteraceae family. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a hairy texture. Conyza ambigua is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
